Preserving Semantic Continuity Embeddings are sensitive to context. A sentence like "He decided to sell it" means nothing without the previous sentence identifying what "it" is. Overlap allows pronouns and references to stay attached to their subjects.

A cat is sitting on the mat and staring outside the window looking at kids playing volleyball in the playfield.
